question: What does HTML stand for?
options: C) Hyperlinks and Text Markup Language
explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

question: Which tag is used to define a paragraph in HTML?
explanation:
The

tag defines a paragraph in HTML. It automatically adds space before and after the content.

question: What is the correct HTML tag for inserting a line break?
explanation:
The
tag is used to insert a line break in HTML. It is a self-closing tag.

question: Which tag is used to create a hyperlink in HTML?
explanation: The <a> (anchor) tag is used to create hyperlinks. The href attribute specifies the destination URL.

question: Which attribute is used to specify the URL of a hyperlink?
explanation: The href (hypertext reference) attribute specifies the URL that the link points to.

question: Which tag is used to display an image in HTML?
explanation: The tag is used to embed images in HTML. It requires the src attribute to specify the image source.

question: Which attribute is used to provide an alternative text for an image?
explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative text for an image if it cannot be displayed, and is important for accessibility.

question: Which tag is used to create an unordered list?
explanation: The <ul> tag creates an unordered (bulleted) list. Each item is defined with <li>.

question: Which tag is used to create an ordered list?
explanation: The <ol> tag creates an ordered (numbered) list. Each item is defined with <li>.

question: Which tag is used to define a list item?
explanation: The <li> tag defines a list item and is used inside <ul> or <ol> elements.

question: Which tag is used to define a table?
explanation: The <table> tag is used to create a table in HTML.

question: Which tag is used to define a table row?
explanation: The <tr> tag defines a row in a table. It contains <td> or <th> elements.

question: Which tag is used to define a table data cell?
explanation: The <td> tag defines a standard data cell in a table. <th> is for header cells.

question: What is the correct HTML tag for the largest heading?
explanation: HTML provides six heading levels, <h1> to <h6>. <h1> is the largest and most important.

question: What is the correct HTML tag for the smallest heading?
explanation: <h6> is the smallest heading level in HTML. Headings go from <h1> (largest) to <h6> (smallest).

question: Which tag is used to define an input field in a form?
explanation: The <input> tag is used to create various form controls like text fields, checkboxes, and buttons.

question: Which input type is used for a text input field?
explanation: The type='text' attribute creates a single-line text input field.

question: Which tag is used to define a button?
explanation: The <button> tag creates a clickable button. You can also use <input type='button'>.

question: Which HTML element is used to define the title of a document?
explanation: The <title> tag defines the title shown in the browser tab. It goes inside the <head> section.

question: Which HTML element defines the document's body?
explanation: The <body> element contains all the visible content of an HTML page.

question: What does the "alt" attribute in the tag specify?
options: A) The alignment of the image
B) An alternate text for the image
answer: B) An alternate text for the image
explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative text displayed when the image cannot be loaded and for screen readers.

question: What is the purpose of the <div> tag?
options: C) Defines a division or a section in an HTML document
answer: C) Defines a division or a section in an HTML document
explanation: The <div> tag is a block-level container used to group elements for styling or layout purposes.

question: What is the purpose of the <head> tag?
options: A) Defines the main content of the document
B) Contains metadata about the document
answer: B) Contains metadata about the document
explanation: The <head> element contains metadata like title, links to stylesheets, and scripts that don't appear on the page.

question: Which attribute is used to define a unique identifier for an element?
explanation: The id attribute provides a unique identifier for an element. Each id must be unique within the page.

question: Which attribute is used to define a class for styling elements?
explanation: The class attribute is used to assign one or more class names to an element for CSS styling.

question: What is the purpose of the <section> tag?
options: A) Defines a section in a document
answer: A) Defines a section in a document
explanation: The <section> tag represents a standalone section of content, typically with its own heading.

question: What does CSS stand for?
explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, used to style and layout web pages.

question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
explanation: The 'color' property in CSS sets the text color of an element.

question: Which CSS property is used to change the background color of an element?
explanation: The 'background-color' property sets the background color of an element.

question: Which CSS property is used to change the font size of text?
explanation: The 'font-size' property specifies the size of the text.

question: Which CSS property is used to add space between lines of text?
explanation: The 'line-height' property sets the height of each line of text, controlling vertical spacing.

question: Which CSS property is used to align text horizontally?
explanation: The 'text-align' property sets the horizontal alignment of text (left, right, center, justify).

question: Which CSS property is used to make text bold?
explanation: The 'font-weight' property sets the weight (boldness) of the font. Values include 'bold' or numeric values like 700.

question: Which CSS property is used to make text italic?
explanation: The 'font-style' property is used to make text italic, oblique, or normal.

question: Which CSS property is used to underline text?
explanation: The 'text-decoration' property adds decorations like underline, overline, or line-through to text.

question: Which CSS property is used to change the font family of text?
explanation: The 'font-family' property specifies the font for text, with fallback options.

question: Which CSS property is used to set the margin of an element?
explanation: The 'margin' property sets the space outside an element's border.

question: Which CSS property is used to set the padding of an element?
explanation: The 'padding' property sets the space between an element's content and its border.

question: Which CSS property is used to set the border of an element?
explanation: The 'border' property sets the border around an element's padding and content.

question: Which CSS property is used to hide an element?
explanation: The 'display' property with value 'none' hides an element completely. 'visibility: hidden' hides but keeps space.

question: Which CSS value for "display" property hides an element and removes it from the document flow?
explanation: display: none completely removes the element from the document flow, unlike visibility: hidden which preserves space.

question: Which CSS property is used to float an element to the left or right?
explanation: The 'float' property positions an element to the left or right, allowing text to wrap around it.

question: Which CSS property is used to set the width of an element?
explanation: The 'width' property sets the width of an element's content area.

question: Which CSS property is used to set the height of an element?
explanation: The 'height' property sets the height of an element's content area.

question: Which CSS property is used to create rounded corners?
explanation: The 'border-radius' property rounds the corners of an element's border.

question: Which CSS selector selects all paragraphs on a page?
explanation: A type selector (just the element name) selects all elements of that type. 'p' selects all paragraphs.

question: Which CSS selector selects an element with the id "myID"?
explanation: The # prefix is used to select elements by their id attribute.

question: Which CSS selector selects an element with the class "myClass"?
explanation: The . (dot) prefix is used to select elements by their class attribute.

question: What is JavaScript primarily used for?
explanation: JavaScript is primarily used for client-side scripting to add interactivity to web pages.

question: Which keyword is used to declare a variable in JavaScript?
explanation: The 'var' keyword declares variables in JavaScript. 'let' and 'const' are modern alternatives.

question: Which operator is used for strict equality in JavaScript?
explanation: The === operator checks both value and type equality, unlike == which performs type coercion.

question: How do you write a single-line comment in JavaScript?
explanation: Single-line comments in JavaScript start with //. Multi-line comments use /* */.

question: Which function is used to print output to the console in JavaScript?
explanation: console.log() outputs messages to the browser's developer console for debugging.

question: What is the purpose of the parseInt() function in JavaScript?
options: A) To convert a string to a floating-point number
B) To convert a string to an integer
C) To convert a number to a string
answer: B) To convert a string to an integer
explanation: parseInt() parses a string and returns an integer. parseFloat() is for floating-point numbers.

question: Which built-in method adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length?
explanation: The push() method adds elements to the end of an array and returns the new length.

question: Which loop is used to iterate over the properties of an object?
explanation: The for...in loop iterates over the enumerable properties (keys) of an object.

question: What is the result of 5 + "5" in JavaScript?
explanation: When adding a number and string, JavaScript converts the number to a string and concatenates them.

question: Which keyword is used to define a function in JavaScript?
explanation: The 'function' keyword is used to declare functions in JavaScript.

question: What is the purpose of the querySelector() method?
options: A) To select all elements that match a CSS selector
B) To select the first element that matches a CSS selector
C) To create a new element
D) To modify an element's style
answer: B) To select the first element that matches a CSS selector
explanation: querySelector() returns the first element that matches the specified CSS selector.

question: What is the purpose of the querySelectorAll() method?
options: A) To select the first element that matches a CSS selector
B) To select all elements that match a CSS selector
C) To create a new element
D) To modify an element's style
answer: B) To select all elements that match a CSS selector
explanation: querySelectorAll() returns a NodeList of all elements that match the specified CSS selector.

question: What is the purpose of the addEventListener() method?
options: A) To remove an event listener
B) To attach an event handler to an element
C) To create a new event
answer: B) To attach an event handler to an element
explanation: addEventListener() attaches an event handler function to an element for a specified event type.

question: What does the "DOM" stand for?
explanation: DOM stands for Document Object Model, a programming interface for HTML documents.

question: Which of the following is used to read an HTML page and render it?
explanation: Web browsers read HTML pages and render them for display to users.

question: What is DOM?
options: B) Hierarchy of objects in ASP.NET
C) Convention for representing and interacting with objects in HTML documents
answer: C) Convention for representing and interacting with objects in HTML documents
explanation: The DOM is a programming interface that represents HTML documents as a tree of objects.

question: Which property is used to control the space between the border and content in a table?
explanation: Padding is the space between an element's content and its border.

question: What is the purpose of JavaScript in web development?
options: A) To define the structure and content of web pages
B) To add interactivity and behavior to web pages
C) To style and format web pages
D) To manage server-side data and databases
answer: B) To add interactivity and behavior to web pages
explanation: JavaScript adds interactivity and dynamic behavior to web pages.

question: Which of the following attributes is used to specify elements to bind style rules to?
explanation: CSS can target elements using id selectors (#), class selectors (.), and element/tag selectors.

question: Which selector is used to specify a rule to bind a particular unique element?
explanation: The id selector targets a unique element since each id should be unique within a page.

question: _________ selectors are used to specify a group of elements.
explanation: Both class selectors and tag selectors can select groups of elements.

question: Which of the following tag is used to embed CSS in HTML page?
explanation: The <style> tag is used to embed internal CSS within an HTML document.

question: What type of selector is used in this case? p {line-height: 150%;}
explanation: Using just 'p' is an element (type) selector that selects all paragraph elements.

question: What type of selector is used in this case? p strong {background-color: yellow;}
options: B) Strong element within a p element have a yellow background
C) Both p and strong have yellow background
answer: B) Strong element within a p element have a yellow background
explanation:
This is a descendant selector that targets elements inside

elements.

question: Where in an HTML document is the correct place to refer to an external style sheet?
options: A) At the end of the document
C) At the top of the document
explanation: External stylesheets are linked in the <head> section using the <link> element.

question: How do you add a background color for all <h1> elements?
explanation: The element selector 'h1' targets all <h1> elements on the page.

question: What is the main difference between <div> and <span> elements in HTML?
options: A) <div> is a block-level element, and <span> is an inline element
B) <div> is an inline element, and <span> is a block-level element
answer: A) <div> is a block-level element, and <span> is an inline element
explanation: <div> is block-level (starts on new line, takes full width), <span> is inline (flows with text).

question: Which HTML element starts on a new line by default?
explanation: <div> is a block-level element that starts on a new line by default.

question: Which of the following statements about <div> and <span> is false?
options: A) <div> can contain other block elements
B) <span> can contain other inline elements
C) <div> is used mainly for layout and grouping
D) <span> automatically adds a line break
answer: D) <span> automatically adds a line break
explanation: <span> is an inline element and does NOT add a line break. Only block elements do.

question: Which CSS property defines a container as a flex container?
explanation: display: flex creates a flex container, enabling flexbox layout for its children.

question: What is the default value of the flex-direction property?
explanation: The default flex-direction is 'row', which arranges items horizontally from left to right.

question: Which property controls the alignment of flex items along the main axis?
explanation: justify-content aligns flex items along the main axis (horizontal in row direction).

question: Which property controls the alignment of flex items along the cross axis?
explanation: align-items aligns flex items along the cross axis (vertical in row direction).

question: Which property specifies how much a flex item will grow relative to the rest?
explanation: flex-grow specifies how much the item should grow relative to other flex items when extra space is available.

question: Which method is used in JavaScript to change the content of an HTML element?
explanation: innerHTML is a property (not method) used to get or set the HTML content inside an element.

question: Which JavaScript event is used when a user clicks on an HTML element?
explanation: The onclick event fires when a user clicks on an element.

question: What does document.getElementById("demo").style.display = "none"; do?
options: B) Hides the element from view
answer: B) Hides the element from view
explanation: Setting display to 'none' hides the element but doesn't remove it from the DOM.

question: Which JavaScript method is used to attach an event handler to an element?
explanation: addEventListener() is the standard method for attaching event handlers.

question: To change the text color of an element with id "title" to red, which code is correct?
explanation: Use getElementById to select the element, then access its style.color property.

question: What does document.querySelector(".btn") select?
options: A) An element with the ID btn
B) All buttons on the page
C) The first element with class btn
answer: C) The first element with class btn
explanation: querySelector with a class selector (.btn) returns the first matching element.

question: What does the document.createElement("p") function do?
options: B) Creates a new paragraph element
C) Deletes an existing paragraph element
answer: B) Creates a new paragraph element
explanation: createElement() creates a new HTML element of the specified type, which can then be added to the DOM.

question: Which method is used to add a newly created element to the DOM?
explanation: appendChild() adds a node as the last child of a parent element, inserting the newly created element into the DOM.
